title: St Mary's woman arrested after sending herself fake death threats and framing older woman
text:
A woman has been arrested after she allegedly tried to frame an older lady for harassment by sending herself fake death threats.

The 29-year-old woman from St Mary's in Western Sydney, received threatening messages in May and July this year, sparking a police investigation.

A 51-year-old woman was arrested in August but after detectives saw CCTV footage and accessed phone evidence, they found out the 29-year-old had in fact sent the threats.

Police allege the woman was seeking revenge on the 51-year-old due to previous court matters.

The 29-year-old woman (pictured) from St Mary's in Western Sydney, received threatening messages in May and July this year, sparking a police investigation

The woman (pictured during arrest) was arrested on Wednesday after detectives found out she had been responsible for sending the threats

In August, the 29-year-old claimed the woman had sent her a box with a written death threat as well as photographs.

The 51-year-old was arrested at her home in Blaxland on August 26 and was issued with an Apprehended Violence Order.

Officers from the Nepean Police Are Command arrested the 29-year-old on Wednesday where she was taken to Penrith Police Station.

A 51-year-old was wrongly arrested in August this year after the woman claimed she had sent her death threats in a box

She was taken to Penrith Police Station where she was charged with various offences including making false accusations with intent to subject other to investigation and threat to prevent information to police.

She will face Penrith Local Court on Wednesday.

The 51-year-old has had the AVO against her dropped.
description: The 29-year-old woman from St Mary's in Western Sydney, received threatening messages in May and July this year, sparking a police investigation.
authors: Eliza Mcphee For Daily Mail Australia
